snippet: Art lovers and historians are scrambling to find ways to preserve the explosion of art that has arisen in public spaces occupied by pro-democracy demonstrators.
abstract: Pro-democracy demonstrations in Hong Kong have led to outpouring of public art that has turned protest sites into outdoor exhibitions; preservationist groups and art lovers are scrambling to figure out how best to save art, like Umbrella Man, 12-foot-tall wood sculpture of figure holding a bright yellow umbrella, for posterity amid fears that city may clear sites.
lead_paragraph: Art lovers and historians are scrambling to find ways to preserve the explosion of art that has arisen in public spaces occupied by pro-democracy demonstrators.

headline.main: Art Spawned by Hong Kong Protest; Now to Make It Live On
headline.print_headline: Art Spawned by Protest; Now to Make It Live On

keywords.value: Umbrella Movement Visual Archives and Research Collective (Hong Kong)
keywords.name: organizations
